alert.note: Alert for De Soto (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 5:16PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern De Soto Parish, southeastern Panola and northeastern Shelby Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 516 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Joaquin, or 10 miles north of Center, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Logansport, Tenaha, Joaquin, Longstreet, Stanley, James and Paxton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Louisiana...and eastern and northeastern Texas.
